attributes.action: Require all buses to have seat belts
attributes.background: Buses have crashes and make sudden stops and people get injured all the time because they are not wearing seat belts.
attributes.additional_details: Recently I was involved in a bus accident (not the bus driver’s fault) where a taxi pulled out. This resulted in me being thrown from my chair and suffering bruised ribs and jarred my chest. This is why all buses should be required to have seat belts.

attributes.action: Add to the school curriculum, educating young people on current world issues
attributes.background: Educating from an early age, it would bring awareness of current issues and give young people a voice as they would have opportunities to get involved. This is important as they are the next generation, therefore, it is vital that they are aware of what is currently happening in the world.

attributes.action: Increase the annual salary of all public sector workers by 3%.
attributes.background:
We, the people of Britain, would like to request an increase of the annual salary for all public sector workers by 3%. In particular, the pay wage of Police, Firefighters and workers of the NHS. 

We feel that the wages should be increased because of the heroic services they provide everyday.
attributes.additional_details:
"The starting salary for Police Officers in England, Wales and Northern Ireland is between £19,971 and £23,124, rising to £38,382 at the top of the scale - achievable after about seven years.."

"Public Sector workers help you when you need it, no matter how bad of a situation. Some make you feel safe and risk their whole life for us, saving lives. They train and dedicated their life to make sure the people of Britain are safe and secure in the area that they live. They deserve more." - Nameless

attributes.action: Remove the VAT on purchase of defibrillators
attributes.background: Encourage the purchase of these life saving devices. Small communities are raising funds to buy these defibrillators for no reason other than to save life. Maybe yours, maybe mine, or maybe a loved one. Remove the tax and encourage the acquisition of this life saving and life changing technology

attributes.action: Protect pension funds from asset strippers by closing Companies Act loopholes.
attributes.background: Under s172 Companies Act 2006, directors must "promote the success of the company" taking into account the long term consequences and the need to act fairly with stakeholders, such as employees. However, Part 23 of the Act fails to prevent the asset-stripping of companies by the unscrupulous.
attributes.additional_details:
Fixed assets should be recorded at fair value before assets are transferred out of the company and the non-distributable revaluation reserve created should remain with the company.
Non-distributable reserves converted to distributable reserves should be accounted for as unrealized profit for dividend purposes and not appropriated from the company. 
Accumulative distributable reserves should be restricted to cover the current pension fund deficit before further distributions are considered.

attributes.action: Make it standard at your 12 week fetal scan that your cervix is also measured
attributes.background: I am currently 23 weeks pregnant.I had my 20 week scan last week.Due to current testing at my hospital they also measured my cervix(which isn't standard practice).My cervix was measuring 6mm instead of approx.4cm.This may have been picked up on previous scan earlier on and prevented such a high risk
attributes.additional_details: 1 in 20 pregnancies experience shortening of the cervix which may lead to late miscarriage or preterm labour. The sooner this is found, the more time hospitals have to try and prevent the cervix getting worse.

attributes.action: Create a National Roads Agency for the repair and maintenance of all roads.
attributes.background: I have had to repair damage to three wheels on my car which were caused by potholes. While driving I spend more time looking out for the potholes and swerving to avoid them.
attributes.additional_details: The roads in this country now compare to that of a third world country and are full of potholes. With local authorities unable to eradicate this problem and only repair the roads on a small scale it is time for the government to set up a national agency with the sole responsibility to repair and maintain roads in England. Motorists already pay enough money through their car road tax and fuel tax and get very little in return.

attributes.action: Reverse 20 years long residency rule to 14 years residency to legalise status.
attributes.background:
Thousands are affected with this rule as it forces individuals to spend their whole life here to get indefinite leave to remain.
So if a person arrives here in his early 20s, he has to spend 20 years of his life to apply only for leave to remain following 3 more leave to remains for next 10 years.
attributes.additional_details:
This rule is a cruel step towards humanity as expecting someone to spend half of his life in United Kingdom with no means, no job, no driving licence and doing odd jobs to survive is against article 8: ‘your right to a private and family life’.
Before July 2012, the rule was 14 years long residency before one used to apply for indefinite leave to remain to settle here unconditionally which was not much bad period.
But Prime Minister Theresa May changed this 14 years long residency with 20 years.

attributes.action: Change delay repay minimum delay to 5 minutes.
attributes.background: Currently delay repay schemes only compensate customers who experience delays of between 15 minutes and 30 minutes. Many more customers who are regularly delayed by 5 minutes or more receive no compensation. This needs to change. Train companies need to be held to account for their mistakes/delays.

attributes.action: Sex crimes against children to receive harsher penalties and mandatory jail time
attributes.background: Paedophiles who arrange to meet children, help facilitate attacks over the internet, download child pornography or sexually abuse children are often getting very little if at all any jail time; this is not a deterrent to those who seek out our children for their own twisted needs.
attributes.additional_details:
More details
It's about time paedophiles are scared of the sentences given at court to deter them from their crimes. No crime is victimless; children are abused so others can download the pictures therefore facilitating this crime. Parents and non parents are outraged when a shoplifter can get a heavier sentence than those who destroy the souls of our children and it's about time that stopped

attributes.action: Force Rail Ticketing to allow for WFH and Auto Delay/Cancellation Repayments
attributes.background:
Our Rail ticketing is clearly out of date and the rail companies are failing 
1) Automatic Repayments should be mandatory for Delays and Cancellations 
2)With occasional Working From Home, tickets should be for a number of days usage not a calendar month or year
attributes.additional_details: The last few year rail travel has been appalling, Southern started a scheme to automatically refund for delays, South Western Railway have stopped this without filling in forms needing completion. They have our details linked to the ticket, this should be an automatic process. Our ticketing is out of date and the rail companies are frankly failing.

attributes.action: 65% majority referendum to approve the offer to leave EU or else stay in the EU
attributes.background:
Lisbon Treaty Art 50 in effect needs 65% of remaining population to approve a state leaving. Therefore 65% of population leaving should approve
UK Companies Act 2006: 75% vote to change rules that govern its conduct with members. We are considering the relationship between the UK and its citizens
attributes.additional_details:
2016 Referendum result: Leave 17,410,742 – 51.89%; Remain 16,141,241- 48.11% – just 3.78% in favour.  This has been, and continues to be, a most divisive and disproportionate margin for the well being of the UK and its citizens

When the 2016 referendum was taken the campaign was generalised slogans and proclamations and could not clearly set out specific consequences and realities: which were at the time impossible to know. Now we know them

To end division and animosity we need clear majority

attributes.action: Funding/ Installation of Wildlife Crossings (Eco Bridges)
attributes.background: We should be funding safe alternatives for animals to pass over or under our busy dangerous roads. We build these roads through their habitats and offer nothing to prevent thousands of animals deaths occurring each year. Something must be done to help protect our struggling wildlife population.
attributes.additional_details:
Examples of successful Eco Bridges are in The Netherlands (over 66 crossings), Australia, Germany, California, Florida, Canada and many more. All have been successful in increasing numbers in wildlife.
The 4 ways that roads negatively impact wildlife: 1 decrease in habitat, 2 increase mortality due to wildlife-vehicle collisions, 3 prevent access to resources on the other side of the road, and 4 they subdivide wildlife populations into smaller and more vulnerable sub-populations.

attributes.action: SELECTIVE licensing for tenants should be removed or applied for all landlords.
attributes.background:
SELECTIVE licensing for certain areas and certain landlords is unfair.

The law should be same for all where ever you live in the country.

This should also be applied to letting agencies and housing estates.
attributes.additional_details:
Lisence is applied when you commence a business and require authority of the council this should be same for everyone not selective.

Also the law should be applied to council areas not privately owned.

Safety of tenants can also be address in many other ways.

We are all equal in England and the law should be passed for all not few.

attributes.action: Increase funding for mental health services and accommodation for veterans
attributes.background: Thousands of ex-military personnel are currently either homeless or suffering with mental health issues. It is diabolical that people who have served this country are being left behind in such a manner; it is high time for the government to start actively tackling this crisis.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/least-13000-hero-soldiers-left-11847000

https://www.bbc.com/news/health-45761546

attributes.action: Say NO to meat tax
attributes.background: Do not consider imposing additional taxes on meat products. Introducing a product specific tax will only serve to penalise the poor. Instead of reducing consumer choices, it would be more beneficial to educate the public about the impact on their health and environment.
attributes.additional_details:
There are examples in the past which show that these sorts of taxes are just another way of extracting more money from the public. Rarely do they have the full desired effect on consumption.
Furthermore, meat is not the leading cause of heart disease or global warming, thus it would make more sense to target those sectors.

attributes.action: Ban Blockchain Mining in the UK
attributes.background: The mining of cryptocurrency such as bitcoin is responsible for the output of enormous amounts of carbon dioxide emissions, the effects of which could cause substantial damage to the environment and contribute to global warming, rising sea levels and more unpredictable extreme weather.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2018/jan/17/bitcoin-electricity-usage-huge-climate-cryptocurrency

https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2018/10/29/bitcoin-may-cause-catastrophic-climate-change-2033-study-warns/

attributes.action: Stop UK Government foreign aid to India
attributes.background: UK’s global aid commitment is in the countries national interest, but when £330 million is squandered on a giant bronze statue in India it must be seriously evaluated whether that money could not better be spent at home.

attributes.action: Consistently implement the Metric System across the UK
attributes.background: The Metric system has only been partially integrated into public life. We measure fuel in litres, speed in mph. Government policy is beer is sold in pints, while other alcohol such as spirits & wine to be sold in litres & ml. The government should implement the metric system in all law & regulation.
attributes.additional_details:
The discrepancy in selling of alcohol:
https://www.gov.uk/weights-measures-and-packaging-the-law/specified-quantities

Examples (as recent as 2000 in the UK) of where conversion errors have caused issues with infrastructure and technology:
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/magazine-27509559

Inconsistency in non metric measurements - the difference between UK and US Imperial measurements:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/skillswise/factsheet/ma21impe-l1-f-converting-imperial-and-metric

attributes.action: Fund a campaign to promote the use of biodegradable hemp packaging
attributes.background: Plastic is fast becoming a problem that humans have caused. Damaging our oceans, infecting sea life and ourselves whilst polluting our planet on a worrying scale. We need to act fast and greatly reduce the amount of plastic being produced. We need to switch to a bio degradable alternative, hemp.
attributes.additional_details:
It is estimated that over 12 tonnes of plastic ends up in our oceans each year. 
The plastic is appearing all over the planet, from beaches here in the U.K. To uninhabited islands in the Pacific. Not only is it choking sealife but it has become part of the food chain eventually ending up on our plate. A biodegradable alternative like Hemp plastic would stop this poison destroying our oceans and our planet.

attributes.action: Allow supply teachers to contribute to the Teachers' Pension Scheme
attributes.background: Over 76% of supply teachers are employed through supply agencies rather than schools. They are denied the right to contribute to and access the Teacher's Pension Scheme.  Agencies must be made to pay the Employer's contribution and give supply teachers the same pension rights as other teachers.
attributes.additional_details:
The daily charge to schools by an agency for a teacher can be as much as £100 more than the amount paid to that teacher. Agencies should use this money to pay Employers contributions. 
There is a steady increase in the casual employment of teachers to fill recruitment and retention gaps. 
https://www.teachers.org.uk/edufacts/supplyteachers
https://www.educationsupportpartnership.org.uk/blogs/claire-renn/handling-money-difficulties-supply-teacher
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/education-35911015

attributes.action: Get rid of metric measures and weights, bring back Imperial measures and weights
attributes.background: Fed up of metres or litres,  when we leave the EU,  we don't need them anymore, let's go back to what we knew as kids.

attributes.action: Government to ban the production and use of all non-recyclable plastic by 2020.
attributes.background: Plastic is choking each and every one of us.  It has filled the land, sea and air. We may not want to accept it but it is in our face. We would like the government to take the initiative to stop the production so it is not available for use in UK and other countries will follow.
attributes.additional_details:
A Roadmap for Sustainability report found more than 60 countries have introduced bans which are one of the most effective ways to reduce the use of disposable plastic.
Plastic items can take up to 1000 years to decompose in landfills. But plastic bags we use in our everyday life take 10-1000 years to decompose, burning it is not an option as well as it releases toxic fumes into the air.
UN warned at current levels the earth could be awash with 12 billion tonnes of plastic trash by the middle of the century.

attributes.action: Ban all chewing gum except therapeutic, dental or nicotine chewing gum.
attributes.background: Chewing gum is pointless. Everywhere you look. There are small white blobs on the pavement - in schools, towns, in public transport, under tables and chairs and even in supermarkets making Britian's town's and cities a unsightly place to live.
attributes.additional_details:
The annual clean-up bill on the UK’s streets has been estimated at £150m. Some councils spend £200,000 a year cleaning up gum from pavements with high-powered hoses. Cash-strapped council's could use this money better elsewhere like Housing, transport, education, police funding AND THE NHS.
On average it costs £1.00 for an average pack of chewing gum, but it costs £1.50 to remove a single piece of dropped gum. This is a waste of tax payers money!
It also causes a nuisance in schools.

attributes.action: Require school housing facilities (boarding houses) to provide recycling bins
attributes.background: Young minds should be taught the importance of protecting the planet so it is there for future generations.In the countryside the evidence of humans encroaching on the environment is very clear. Schools have the ability to change the minds of the future and should use this ability for our benefit.
attributes.additional_details: School’s with an average of 650 pupils plus staff produces a lot of waste annually. That waste should be disposed of correctly and safely.Up to 60% of the rubbish that ends up in the bin could be recycled and isn’t. Also, there is 260 million tons of plastic produced each year (globally), about 10 percent ends up in our oceans. This plastic can take between 450-1000 years to decompose.

attributes.action: Consider funding a northern bypass for Ipswich.
attributes.background: The Orwell bridge. A14. Major artery from the expanding port of felixstowe. When the bridge gets closed in either direction due to bad weather, usually high winds, or a road traffic incident. All traffic is diverted through Ipswich town which causes absolute mayhem.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-suffolk-44656588

One particular day the wind brought down trees and blocked local roads which were already congested due to tge bridge closure. This particular day it took me 90 minutes to get to work, 7 miles away...! There was an idea of allowing cars only in high winds but surely that would pose health and safefy issues.

attributes.action: Change 30 hours free child care eligible 51 weeks a year instead of term time
attributes.background: Current funding of 30 free hours only covers term time which for most working parents only actually covers maybe a day and a half child care as like me most work full time meaning if you have more then 1 child costs soon add up.  get the government to change 30hours free a week not just in term

attributes.action: Ban cot bumpers and baby sleeping aids from being sold in the UK
attributes.background:
Every year babies die in cots where parents use bumpers and positional sleeping aids. These deaths are unnecessary and many are avoidable. 

The recommendations for safe sleep do not include these items and many parents are misinformed in the safety of these.

attributes.action: Better treatment for NHS dialysis patients
attributes.background:
Government figures. I If a patient enters dialysis after the age of 
70to 75 life expectancy is 1 to 2 years. I entered at the age of 82 I am now in my 7th year.
attributes.additional_details:
Kidney failure
This petition could apply to any person of any age. 
I never had kidney failure, I had two operations 12 years apart each operation killed one kidney. 	 
I diagnosed myself and informed the doctor in writing more than a dozen times when I had a closure of an artery,  
There is a system for detecting closures it’s called a transonic flow meter it is used on patients once every three months? 
My petition is for the flow meter to be used on the patient four times a month with a minimum of twice a month.
It will mean patients living longer but that is what nursing is all about? 
Please sign this petition, you will be helping others and by unfortunate chance you might be helping your self.

attributes.action: Routinely arm all UK Police Officers.
attributes.background:
The British Police face numerous threats including terrorists, robbers, drug dealers, in addition to the growing numbers teenagers who now regularly carry knives.

These individuals have no fear, do not value life and would not think twice about shooting or stabbing an unarmed Police Officer.

attributes.action: Make all UK schools take GCSEs
attributes.background:
If you attend a state school now, you must take GCSEs 9-1. But if you are more privileged and go to a private school, you can take IGCSEs. 
IGCSEs can be easier than the new GCSEs 9-1 but are considered as equal levels of education. Should the rich be able to pay for easier qualifications?
attributes.additional_details:
Take English Literature for example, at IGCSE level, it's not totally closed book and you have the option to have 40% coursework. Not to mention the added 20% mark for speaking! Whereas at GCSE 9-1 level, exams are worth 100% of your grade and it's fully closed book - you must remember lots of quotes. 

Surely everyone has the right to take equal tests for equal qualifications?

http://everythingenglisheducation.co.uk/everything-english-education-gcse-reforms-igcse-versus-gcse-guess-who-wins/”

attributes.action: Make Michaelmas Day (29th September) a public holiday.
attributes.background:
Michaelmas (Mickle-mas) was The Feast of St Michael and was used to celebrate the final harvest.  Everything that couldn't be preserved was eaten in a great feast.

This holiday would be a dress rehearsal for Christmas, minus the relatives and presents!

attributes.action: Require fire evacuation and lockdown drills in UK schools and colleges
attributes.background: I am very interested in health and safety and I want to feel like I make a difference to this country by making our schools and colleges a safer environment for staff and students by carrying out fire evacuations termly and a lockdown procedure test at least once a year.

attributes.action: Safeguard School Milk Funding Post-Brexit
attributes.background: With funding for the EU School Milk Scheme under consideration, and the Nursery Milk Scheme being consulted on, millions of children may be at risk of missing out on milk that generations before them received. We're calling on the Government to commit to funding a replacement scheme post-Brexit

attributes.action: Ban Saturday school in all private schools to make the systems fair
attributes.background: Many private schools have Saturday school and many others don’t. Saturday school is a huge effort and much more money for parents to spend on their education. As a student you need rest and Saturday school does not allow this.

attributes.action: Reduce the amount of homework received by primary school students.
attributes.background: Being a student myself, I know the struggle. Children in primary education receive an unnecessary amount of homework each week, and need to be enjoying their childhood, and being more active. The only important homework is reading and spellings.
attributes.additional_details: Some of the homework they receive is sometimes difficult to understand, and not always relevant to their learning. Not only do the students feel pressurised at such a young age, but it can also cause conflict at home between the student and their parents. This is due to the parents also feeling stressed.

attributes.action: Require all dog breeders to keep a correct record of Dogs chipped and sold on.
attributes.background: Today 5 Dogs caught as strays....have a chip no. but either not registered or no longer a current contact.

attributes.action: Ensure school curriculum includes educating students on crime and consequences
attributes.background: Crime at young ages affects everyone in the community. It affects the offender as they should be learning and that is postponed or permanently stopped. It would affect the victim as it would affect any victim mentally. It will also affect the community as a whole, making the area look atrocious.

attributes.action: Add Middle Rate Mobility for children receiving Disability Living Allowance
attributes.background:
My 10 year daughter has hyper mobility type Ehlers Danlos Syndrome, she has low muscle tone, subluxations of joints, swelling of joints, widespread joint pain to name a few symptoms. 
She has ankle braces, insoles, a wheelchair and other aids to help but she has never been entitled to mobility.
attributes.additional_details:
There is 3 rates of care but only 2 for mobility and the criterias for 2 rates don’t accomadate for children like my daughter. 
For LRM the criteria is the child needs ‘guidance or supervision with walking on unfamiliar routes’ and for HRM the criteria is the child must be unable to walk, virtually unable to walk, have no legs or feet, be SMI, be SVI, be blind and deaf or be a danger to them self. There should be an in between for children who have days where they need a wheelchair etc.

attributes.action: Create a governing body to regulate private landlords to protect tenants
attributes.background: Too many private landlords do not carry out their legal obligations at the detriment of their tenants. A governing body is required to regulate such requirements and support tenants whom need to report such landlords for not meeting safety & obligatory maintenance and to investigate harrassment
attributes.additional_details: If you have been subjected to unsafe living conditions, patronising responses, lack of communication and no action taken on much needed property repairs and/or maintenance, then a regulating body is required to fully investigate in depth. Local authorities currently do not have enough capacity to assist with such needs across the UK.

attributes.action: Ban the use of full names in GP or hospital waiting rooms
attributes.background: Confidentiality is up most important in settings such as GP surgeries and hospitals. Data protection laws are tougher now than ever. However they don’t seem to apply when in a waiting room, the professional will call you through by using your full name in front of other people.
attributes.additional_details: I am starting this petition after a prisoner attached to their guard in a waiting room was called through for his appointment. All it took was for me to google their name and gather information as to why they were in prison, how long their sentence was and their address. People’s identities should be protected in GP and hospital waiting rooms.

attributes.action: Scrap the CQC as an onerous bombastic regulation lead organisation
attributes.background: The CQC and its predecessors have developed this watch dog role since 2004, and it’s worth asking what if anything, these state appointed monitors have contributed to health and social care during that time, apart from undermining leadership and interrupting health care delivery.
attributes.additional_details: I believe the CQC have made clear mistakes over recent years. It is clear that they are unlikely to change their methodology and a majority of health care professionals across the country think they are not fit for purpose, and wish to see a change in the way health and social care is regulated.

attributes.action: Ban night shift working, for the sake of the health of workers
attributes.background: Studies have established that the health of workers in the UK is directly negatively affected by night shift working. I ask Parliament to hold a debate over this practice. Why are hard-working people being made to suffer unnecessarily, and why does the Health and Safety at Work Act not protect them?
attributes.additional_details: Long-term night shift work is associated with an increased risk of certain cancers, as well as metabolic problems, heart disease, ulcers and gastrointestinal problems. People who work night shifts or rotating shifts often don't sleep enough. Long-term sleep deprivation is known to be bad for health. Statistics show that a large amount of UK workers are shift workers and, in particular, night shift workers.

attributes.action: Stop Cat D (open prisons) holding sex offenders within 5 miles of any school.
attributes.background: Safety for all our children. An open prison means prisoners can leave prison unescorted. Being near any school I feel this is asking for trouble and very dangerous.

attributes.action: Impose a 3 to 5% sales tax for online every day retail purchases- exc food, hols
attributes.background: Town centres are the beating heart of the community in Britain. As well as the environmental impact of ordering everything online, trying it on, sending it back etc big dominant US retailers take money out of the UK with unfair tax dodges. Let's boost the high street, or chancery coffers, with e-VAT

attributes.action: Stop the state pension reducing tax allowances for working pensioners
attributes.background: Many people remain in work beyond retirement age training the next generation. Some work because they need to top up their income rather than turn to the state for benefits. Decreasing tax codes re-taxes PAYBACK of money already paid in tax. This was not an investment but saving.
attributes.additional_details: What the government should do is change the law so the state pension doesn't count towards someone's personal tax allowance if they are working. Having completed one working career paying for that pension, the government should allow people to continue to work without having their tax code reduced. This double tax on pensions puts people off continuing to contribute to society. The well being of remaining part time in work reduces a burden on the state. State pension is a PAYBACK and not an additional income!

attributes.action: Make it a law that every work place need to supply air conditioning units.
attributes.background: Every work place now won’t supply air conditioning as it’s not Essential however if we made it a law many schools, nursurys and work places would Benefit.
attributes.additional_details:
There is no law which says you have to go home just that your work place has to supply water. 
Let’s make a change!

attributes.action: Make more council houses available for part rent, part buy
attributes.background: I'm a working dad of 2 children under 2 year old. Me and my partner can't afford to live together as I don't earn enough to support us and pay private rent. The Government should introduce a scheme to make more council homes available for families to part rent part buy to get on the property ladder.
attributes.additional_details: More and more families are struggling to live together with young children. My children are 14 month old and a 2 week old. Like a lot of families me and my partner can’t afford to live together as I work full time and she doesn't as she raises the children. The systems we have in this country don't help people who work. Help to buy is only good if you can afford to save but with young children and paying rent that's more than a mortgage, it's hard to save.

attributes.action: Provide a minimum of 100 litres of clean water per person daily, free of charge
attributes.background:
Water supply is fast becoming one of the most expensive utilities.
I believe every UK citizen should be entitled to a minimum amount, supplied free of charge by all regional water companies, enough to provide the basic human needs and maintain health and hygiene at a good standard.
attributes.additional_details:
Water is now an expensive commodity.
There is no option of choice of supplier in the water supply industry for private households.
Water is a life essential and any modern country should be required to provide a minimum amount free of charge to maintain health in the population.

attributes.action: To review current criminal law relating to rape and sexual offences.
attributes.background:
I would like the government to review current law and to implement a 3-point plan.

Educate - To make sexual education compulsory in all Secondary schools.
Prevent - Increased awareness around high-risk areas (nightclubs, pubs etc).
Prosecute - Increase current minimum term guideline for crimes.
attributes.additional_details:
I believe more can be done to reduce crime relating to rape and sexual offences. I am constantly heartbroken, daily, to read about it on the news. The crime is unforgivable and I think we have a duty as a society to call for more action which will protect the general public. 

- Approximately 85,000 women and 12,000 men are raped in England and Wales alone every year.
- Rape Crisis specialist services were accessed by 78,461 individuals an increase of 17% from 2016-17.
